title: Revolution Part 5 - Liberty & The Phrygian Cap
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: The ancient symbolism of Liberty through the Phrygian Cap, tracing its journey from Turkey to Rome to the French Revolution to the Statue of Liberty

jefferson_on_liberty.blood_of_patriots: The tree of Liberty must be refreshed from time to time with the blood of patriots and tyrants
jefferson_on_liberty.rightful_liberty: Unobstructed action according to our will, within the limits drawn around us by the equal rights of others
jefferson_on_liberty.law_caveat: I do not add 'within the limits of the law' because law is often but the tyrant's will

franklin_on_liberty.absence_of_opposition: By Liberty is sometimes understood the Absence of Opposition
franklin_on_liberty.comparison: Liberty like a falling body - free to fall, meets nothing to hinder, but necessitated to fall
franklin_on_liberty.providence_argument: We have but one chance in ten thousand to hit on the right action - must be governed by Providence

phrygia_origins.phrygian_cap: Hat from Phrygia became symbol of Liberty

bekos_experiment.purpose: Determine which language is older - Kemet or Phrygia
bekos_experiment.implication: Phrygian may be an innate language

phrygian_cap_symbolism.meaning: Ancient symbol of Liberty and establishing Republics
phrygian_cap_symbolism.connection_to_plato: Associated with Plato's concept of the Republic
phrygian_cap_symbolism.senate_origins: Senate is Ancient Greek concept, originally made of Elders
phrygian_cap_symbolism.roman_usage: Worn by freed slaves in Ancient Rome

julius_caesar_assassination.event: Brutus and inner circle assassinated Caesar
julius_caesar_assassination.action: Assassins held Phrygian Cap on a pole
julius_caesar_assassination.purpose: To free the slaves in Rome
julius_caesar_assassination.origin_of_liberty_pole: This pole became known as the Liberty Pole

phrygian_cap_appearances.barbary_pirates: Often indicated in drawings by Phrygian Cap

french_revolution.pairing: Guillotine and Phrygian Cap used together as symbols
french_revolution.zouave_soldiers: French soldiers sent to help Americans, mainly Algerian
french_revolution.hat_style: Wore hat similar to Phrygian Cap

santa_claus.saint_nicholas: Originally wore hat similar to Phrygian Cap
santa_claus.modern_version: Phrygian Cap with fluff ball at end
santa_claus.note: You may already own a Phrygian Cap without realizing it

statue_of_liberty.surface_meaning: Symbol of acceptance, has poem about immigration
statue_of_liberty.design_elements: Wears crown and holds torch of Mithras

liberation.primary: The act of setting someone free from imprisonment, slavery, or oppression; release
liberation.secondary: Freedom from limits on thought or behavior

hannibal_barca.achievement: Took over Italy for 15 years while Rome regrouped

art_of_war.author: Sun Tzu (200 BC)
art_of_war.key_teaching: Everything else is cosmetic - cannot win war without Counter Intelligence

hashashins.method: Pretend to be slaves, servants, or use other disguises
hashashins.goal: Get into inner circle of enemy King or leader
hashashins.patience: Sometimes years undercover as a slave
hashashins.outcome: Assassinate target and anyone around them

quiz_questions.q: Where does the Phrygian Cap originate from?
quiz_questions.a: Phrygia - the region now called Turkey, known for cherries, roses, and red things
quiz_questions.explanation: Ancient symbol that traveled through Rome, France, to America

quiz_questions.q: What was the result of the Bekos experiment?
quiz_questions.a: Children raised in isolation first said 'Bekos' - Phrygian for 'Bread'
quiz_questions.explanation: Egyptian Pharaoh's experiment to determine oldest language

quiz_questions.q: Where did the Liberty Pole originate?
quiz_questions.a: Julius Caesar's assassination - Brutus held Phrygian Cap on pole to free slaves
quiz_questions.explanation: The pole with the cap became symbol of liberty

quiz_questions.q: What is the Statue of Liberty actually representing according to @marsresident?
quiz_questions.a: She wears the crown and holds the torch of Mithras - symbol of Liberty and Revolution
quiz_questions.explanation: Deeper than just immigration - connected to ancient liberty symbolism

quiz_questions.q: What did Sun Tzu say was essential to winning war?
quiz_questions.a: Counter Intelligence - everything else is cosmetic without it
quiz_questions.explanation: Five classes of spies: Local, Inward, Converted, Doomed, Surviving
